data.title: Run android project problem
data.body:
Cannot run start project on my android phone. My OS is Windows 7. 
- cocos2d-x version: cocos2d-x-3.15.1
- devices test on: LG X Power
- developing environments
   - NDK version: android-ndk-r14b 
   - Xcode version: -
   - VS version: Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2015 14.0.25431.01 Update 3
   - browser type and version: 

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Clone the repo from GitHub.
  $ git clone https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x.git

2. After cloning the repo, please execute download-deps.py to download and install dependencies.
  $ cd cocos2d-x
  cocos2d-x $ python download-deps.py

3. After running download-deps.py.
  cocos2d-x $ git submodule update --init

All steps above is **OK**

After this I did this steps:
Run setup.py
Run the cocos script
$ cd cocos2d-x
$ ./setup.py
$ source FILE_TO_SAVE_SYSTEM_VARIABLE
$ cocos new MyGame -p com.your_company.mygame -l cpp -d NEW_PROJECTS_DIR
$ cd NEW_PROJECTS_DIR/MyGame
cocos run -p android -j 4 --ap android-21

Error log is following:
```
make: Entering directory `C:/projects/ProjectTest/GameFirst/proj.android'
[armeabi] "Gdbserver      ": "[arm-linux-androideabi-4.9] libs/armeabi/gdbserver"
make: *** No rule to make target `jni/jni/hellocpp/main.cpp', needed by `obj/local/armeabi/objs-debug/MyGame_shared/jni/hellocpp/ma[armeabi] "Gdbsetup       ": "libs/armeabi/gdb.setup"
in.o'.  Stop.
make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
make: Leaving directory `C:/projects/ProjectTest/GameFirst/proj.android'
Error running command, return code: 2.
```
How can I fix this problem?

data.title: Node::detachChild() shouldn't use childIndex
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1

It's kind of hard to reproduce, but `Node::detachChild()` can lead to crash.

 I had a case, where removing a child with a `PhysicsBody` caused a `sortAllChildren()` of the `_parent`.

Via 
`ComponentContainer::onExit()`, `PhysicsWorld::collisionSeparateCallbackFunc()`, `Node::visit()`...

A recently changed localZOrder was still dirty. 
This lead to a change of position in `_children`. 
`detachChild()` tried to remove the wrong child.
This resulted in a "Node still marked as running" assert failure. -> **crash**.

----------


An easy fix for this would be to change the last line in `Node::detachChild()` to
```
 _children.eraseObject(child);
```
It is a bit of a performance trade-off since `removeChild()` already looked for `child` in `_children` to check (is this even necessary??) whether it's valid to detach it, but since it can't be guaranteed 100% that `_children` won't be changed in the meantime, it shouldn't be done this way.

----------


I think the declaration of `detachChild()` should be changed IMHO. It's potentially dangerous.

`Node::detachChild()` doesn't need `childIndex` at all. It's not a big change.
 `detachChild()` is only used by `Node::removeChild()`.

I doubt a lot of projects did an `override` for `detachChild()`. So it's not a big deal to break backwards compatibility here.

With the declaration of `detachChild()` changed to  
```
void Node::detachChild(Node *child, bool doCleanup)
```
 `Node::removeChild()` could be changed to:
```
if( _children.contains(child))  this->detachChild( child, cleanup );
```

data.title: On XCode projects, removed specific SDK versions from framework paths.
data.body: Now instead of, for example: `Developer/SDKs/iPhoneOS7.1.sdk/` which is no longer present we have `Developer/SDKs/iPhoneOS.sdk/` so frameworks are no longer missing and marked as red on XCode.

data.title: cocos2d::ccCardinalSplineAt should take arguments by const reference
data.body:
This function is used internally by CardinalSplineTo (and other actions derived therefrom), but it is also useful outside as a friendly library function (as its placement in the header file for CCActionCatmullRom would suggest is its purpose).

The current function signature is `Vec2 ccCardinalSplineAt(Vec2 &p0, Vec2 &p1, Vec2 &p2, Vec2 &p3, float tension, float t)`.  The `Vec2` arguments are taken by reference, helpfully to avoid making unnecessary copies (they are _not_ modified inside the function), but because they are not `const` references, it makes the function frustrating to use, because non-`const` 'lvalue references' cannot bind to the result of an expression:
```
Vec2 pointA, pointB;
const Vec2 pointC;
// ...
auto result = ccCardinalSplineAt(
    pointA + pointB, // error: no matching function for call to 'ccCardinalSplineAt'. 1st argument ('const Vec2&') would lose const qualifier
    pointA - pointB, // same error
    pointC, // same error
    pointA.getNormalized(), // same error, etc.
    1.f,
    1);
```

One must resort to frustrating things, such as spelling out all the arguments in local variables beforehand, or doing evil things like casting away `const` on `pointC` above.

The interface would be much friendlier with a simple addition of `const`. To clarify, this would not break any existing user code*; it would make the function strictly more usable in more places. My proposed new function signature is:
```
Vec2 ccCardinalSplineAt(const Vec2 &p0, const Vec2 &p1, const Vec2 &p2, const Vec2 &p3, float tension, float t)
```

\* unless they were explicitly referring to the signature as-is, in their own prototype declaration within `namespace cocos2d`, instead of `#include`ing CCActionCatmullRom.h

I would have submitted this as a pull request, but I'm brand new to the community and wanted to say hi first.  Hello!

data.title: fixed #17922: [android] AudioEngine may crash while audio's over and stop state is triggered at the same time.
data.body:
The Pull Request #17748 didn't resolve the issue since _track->getPrevState() will be wrong while in scheduler callback. We need to capture it in lambda.
My Pull Request also merges PR #17716 to make filePath captured by lambda.

data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3
- devices test on: GNU/Linux (Ubuntu 16.04)
- developing environments
   - NDK version: -
   - Xcode version: -
   - VS version: -
   - browser type and version: -

Steps to Reproduce:

```
$ uname -a
Linux machine 4.4.0-79-generic #100-Ubuntu SMP Wed May 17 19:58:14 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ mkdir "~/Desktop/demo/" && cd "~/Desktop/demo/"
$ git clone https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x.git && cd cocos2d-x
$ python download-deps.py
$ git submodule update --init
$ ./setup.py
$ source /home/whk/.bashrc
$ cd build/
$ ./install-deps-linux.sh
$ sudo apt update
$ sudo apt upgrade
$ sudo apt install libxmu-dev libgl2ps-dev g++-4.9 libzip-dev libcurl4-gnutls-dev
$ cd ..
$ cocos new DemoProject -p cl.whk.demo -l js && cd DemoProject
$ cocos run -p linux
...
[100%] Linking CXX executable bin/MyGame
[100%] Built target MyGame
Build succeed.
Deploying mode: debug
Starting application.
running: '/home/whk/Desktop/demo/simulator/linux/MyGame'

/home/whk/Desktop/demo/simulator/linux/MyGame: error while loading shared libraries: libfmod.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Error running command, return code: 127.
```
Y copied /home/whk/Desktop/demo/cocos2d-x/external/linux-specific/fmod/prebuilt/64-bit/* to /usr/share/libs/ and make symbolic link from libfmod.so to libfmod.so.6 but does not work, the app say same error.

Checking the dependencies:

data.title: Canot asign COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT enviroments with blank spaces in path
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3
- devices test on: GNU/Linux (Ubuntu 16.04)
- developing environments
   - NDK version: -
   - Xcode version: -
   - VS version: -
   - browser type and version: -

Steps to Reproduce:

```
$ date
sun jun 11 12:01:09 CLT 2017
$ uname -a
Linux machine 4.4.0-79-generic #100-Ubuntu SMP Wed May 17 19:58:14 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ mkdir "~/Desktop/cocos demo/" && cd "~/Desktop/cocos demo/"
$ git clone https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x.git && cd cocos2d-x
$ python download-deps.py
$ git submodule update --init
$ ./setup.py
...
Please execute command: "source /home/whk/.bashrc" to make added system variables take effect
$ source /home/whk/.bashrc
-bash: export: `demo/cocos2d-x/tools/cocos2d-console/bin': no es un identificador válido
-bash: export: `demo/cocos2d-x/templates': no es un identificador válido
$ tail ~/.bashrc
export COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT=/home/whk/Desktop/cocos demo/cocos2d-x/tools/cocos2d-console/bin
export PATH=$COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT:$PATH

# Add environment variable COCOS_X_ROOT for cocos2d-x
export COCOS_X_ROOT=/home/whk/Desktop/cocos demo
export PATH=$COCOS_X_ROOT:$PATH

# Add environment variable COCOS_TEMPLATES_ROOT for cocos2d-x
export COCOS_TEMPLATES_ROOT=/home/whk/Desktop/cocos demo/cocos2d-x/templates
export PATH=$COCOS_TEMPLATES_ROOT:$PATH
```

The enviroment using spaces in the path but the bash interprete as argument. Please use quotes for the paths.

Example:
`export COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT="/home/whk/Desktop/cocos demo/cocos2d-x/tools/cocos2d-console/bin";`

And scape quotes by backslash quote to prevent inyection and arbitrary code execution vulnerability.

data.title: the correctness of the newest CCDownloader-android on android
data.body:
I use CCDownloader to download zip of hotupdate. During downloading, i changed wifi to 4g or wifi to another wifi, the downloaded zip's md5 is not equals to the original zip. But the zip can decompress and the files is equls to original files. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22761531/26972119-f67acfd2-4d42-11e7-9c01-8b2d1b9ed303.png)

But these case won't happen on iOS.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
update console to fix crash when compiling ios
data.body: related issue https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/17873
